text.section: A member may purchase service credit as provided in this section for periods of employment described in subsection (c) or (d) of this section for which the member is not otherwise entitled to service credit.

section.section:
A member who purchases service credit under this section shall:
complete a claim for the service credit and file it with the Board of Trustees on a form that the Board of Trustees provides; and
pay to the Board of Trustees an amount equal to the annuity reserve and pension reserve required to fund the additional allowance.
Except as provided in paragraphs (3) and (4) of this subsection, the member shall pay for service credit purchased under this section at retirement.

The surviving spouse of a member of the Teachers' Retirement System may pay for the appropriate final adjustment under paragraph (3) of this subsection if:
the member dies while employed as a member;
the member was purchasing service credit through a payroll deduction; and
the service credit qualifies for benefits under § 29-205 of this article.
